article.description: Darryl Partin scored 32 points, including six free throws in the final 38 seconds, and Boston University held off Cornell 66-61 on Saturday.
article.headline: Darryl Partin leads way as BU holds on against Cornell
article.linkText: Partin leads way as BU holds on against Cornell
article.story: BOSTON -- Darryl Partin scored 32 points, including six free throws in the final 38 seconds, and Boston University held off Cornell 66-61 on Saturday. Partin, who entered the game shooting 26.7 percent from the field and 20 percent from 3-point range, made 10 of 14 field goals, including 5 of 6 from three-point range. The effort matched his season total of 3-pointers before Saturday's game. Boston U. trailed 38-34 in the second half and went on a 13-0 run to lead 47-38 with 9:15 remaining. Cornell answered with an 11-1 run. With Boston U. leading 58-57 with 1:06 remaining, Partin scored the Terriers' next six points at the free throw line for a 64-59 lead with 13 seconds left. John Holland added 11 points for the Terriers (4-3). Drew Ferry scored 22 points on the strength of six 3-pointers to lead Cornell (2-4), which has lost three in a row by a total of 12 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
